For a while it's a frantic shooter game, then it's a touching confession, afterwards it is a parable about the ideological turmoil in America. The others would break it into pieces, but quantum physics and its creators that are hell-bent on going further than other big productions hold it firmly together. Irrational has delivered a bigger story, more polished experience. Bioshock Infinite is a visionary piece of entertainment where the gameplay, characters, art style and story all come together to make what undoubtedly is one of the greatest games ever made.
肯列文成功地给了我们一座难以忘记的天空之城

Com certeza, ainda estou jogando e estou gostando demais do game. Sempre quis jogá-lo, desde a época em que foi lançado, porém não tinha condições e nem um computador bom. Felizmente, em 2022, pude realizar o meu desejo de comprar não só esse, assim, como a coleção inteira pela Steam. Estou verdadeiramente amando! Recomendo demais, o game também apresenta questões importantes e delicadas da época que infelizmente até hoje existem em nossa sociedade. Novamente, o game não é uma simples aventura, ele é repleto de cor, e não só por suas paisagens, entretanto por sua história e narrativa.

Por si alguien no sabe como hacer papas fritas, y les pinta hacerlas mientras andan por aca:

0) Tener papas xd
1) Pelar, lavar y cortar las papas en bastones. Dejarlas un rato en un bol con agua para que larguen el almidón.
2) Colar el agua y dejarlas escurrir bien, que no queden mojadas.
3) podés terminar de secarlas sobre una servilleta limpia.
4) LLevar al fuego la sartén con aceite. OJO! No pongas aceite hasta arriba porque cuando ponés las papas se vuelca !xd
5) Cuando el aceite está bien caliente, agregar las papas (ysi).
6) Agregar el resto de las papas. Si son muchas papas no las amontones! Cocinalas por tandas, si no se pegotean.
7) Cuando las papas se empiezan a dorar, las podés dar vuelta con ayuda de una espátula para que se terminen de hacer.Te vas a dar cuenta, además de por el color, porque movés despacito la sartén y las ves firmes.
8) Cuando adquirieron un dorado parejo ya están.
9) Sácalas del aceite con una espumadera, o una espátula de alambre o cualquier cosa que te permita escurrir el exceso de aceite. Ponelas en un recipiente sobre servilletas de papel que van a terminar de absorber lo que les quedó de aceite. Salar y servir.
10) No te desmoralices si no te salen de una. Seguí probando que le vas a encontrar la vuelta amigo.

[b]Reviewing info: [/b] How I rate/review and other info is [url=https://desozone.wordpress.com/main-info/review-scoring-explanation/]HERE[/url] . [i]W.I.P This sentence will not be included if review format is finalized and blog updated.[/i]
[b]Review layout: [/b] STEAM
[b]Review type: [/b] Game
[b]Review format: [/b] Normal, lazy
[h1]PROs: [/h1]
✅	Pleasant artstyle
✅	Very enjoyable world (nice looking, fancy) (Never liked aquatic themed things like first games had)
✅	As usual great narrative presentation, did enjoy the story itself as well this time
✅	Elizabeth sidekick is cute and how she interacts with stuff/idle animations are cute
✅	No more switching between 100 weapons constantly because of running out of ammo 
✅	With Elizabeth combat is more dynamic and interesting (give free stuff, opens rifts that give you combat assistance
✅	Gore is nice
✅	Abilities have projectile and trap mode
✅	Love the mystery eccentric duo
✅	Skylines are fun
✅	Executions
[h1]CONs:[/h1]
❌	Some missing graphic settings that you are force to tweak in config (i.e motion blur, DoF, UI scaling)
❌	Don’t like the Charlie Chaplin styled lore reels
❌	Wish “enter” could be rebinded… literally only key I have to travel across the keyboard to do things..
❌	Mouse sensitivity is lowered a lot when sprinting
❌	Story’wise Elizabeth can be quite obnoxious (but overall she was great)
❌	No manual saving
❌	Whats with ammo quantity at the later part of the game…
❌	Ability based key interaction were minimal / introductionary 
[h1]Comments:[/h1]
Pretty comical how Elizabeth warps around the moment you turn around camera. I somehow managed to get myself stuck as well in the first 30min of gameplay (jumped on stuff then got eventually stuck)
One thing that I found annoying but were at start like “hmm that’s nice”. Is the ammo management. First half of the game or even more, you get ammo everywhere and Elizabeth also gives you free ammo… but after certain threshold in game ammo becomes suddenly so scarce, which was really annoying. I mostly were forced to melee around as I hate collecting random guns on the ground from enemies as not only I haven’t upgraded em, but also that ruins my meta gameplay. I usually end up choosing guns I like the most, upgrading them and using the whole game, which was really nice at first half of the game as I got 0 ammo issues.
With weapon upgrades you have to be picky. As throughout the game I could upgrade only 2 weapons fully.
If compared to previous installations…. I enjoyed this the most. Artstyle was more pleasant, enjoyable sidekick, more entertaining characters and world was much much more fun and pleasant to explore. Sky islands with skylines was tons of fun. Also gunplay wasn’t so obnoxious. As you essentially could pick between plenty of weapons that you like the most and upgrade them. Plus boost your choice of gunplay with gear and abilities. By the end I rolled with rifle and RPG with projectile shield and crows as ability. Damn crows were OP, they essentially disabled the whole arena, especially once you get upgrades for it. Another thing that made gunplay more fun is that you didn’t have to constantly switch between weapons as you got plenty of ammo and with gear could get even more. Previous bioshock stories were maybe more “realistic” in a sense… had sense of mystery.. but this was simply purer form of entertainment. There were fun twists, eccentric elements and more straightforward premise.
As for DLCs there is challenge mode I couldn’t be bothered and story DLC of different parallel world. In story DLC we back to aquatic world sadly…. And ammo became cancer again. I ran out of ammo so often that were forced to melee shit… Also think I liked this Elizabeth the most, she hot.
Part 2 intro was, interesting for sure I guess for lelz? Lockpicking minigames, going through vents, sneak killing enemies, using enemies against each other is essentially part 2.
Part 1 of DLC focuses on action/gunplay, part 2 focuses on stealth

Bioshock Infinite não tem nada a ver com os outros 2 Bioshocks. Talvez eles tenham algumas semelhanças nos poderes e alguns Easter Eggs que aparecem durante o jogo pra criar uma nostalgia em jogadores antigos da franquia, mas as semelhanças acabam aí.

A história do jogo é muito boa, você fica bem confuso até que de fato o Plot aconteça, vale a pena jogar simplesmente pela história.
A jogabilidade não é ruim, mas eu senti falta de alguns elementos que os outros Bioshocks apresentaram que neste não teve, como poder carregar várias armas ou ter Medkits disponíveis para usar na hora que o jogador achasse necessário.
Os gráficos deste jogo são muito bons, pensando que o jogo é de 2013 e que foi lançado no PS3 e Xbox 360, é impressionante o que eles conseguiram entregar.

Bioshock Infinite é um jogo que vale a pena jogar simplesmente pelo mistério da história, mas ele também consegue ser um FPS divertido com elementos de exploração bem interessantes.

Me prendeu desde o momento que eu comecei, até o final, e meus amigos... Que final épico!!!!! Sem sombra de dúvidas é atualmente um dos melhores jogos que eu já joguei na vida, o que é engraçado pois eu desisti dos anteriores. Para quem não pegou de graça na Epic, vai do pacote que vem os 3 e os remaster, Jogo bonito visualmente, mesmo sendo meio cartoonizado, como de costume em jogos da 2K, ou seja, roda em qualquer batata. História épica, personagens marcantes, imersão e ambientação excelentes tornaram a minha nota de um não crítico em... 10/10.

Obs: tenta não pegar spoiler de nada do jogo, pois o jogo te surpreenderá bastante.
명작 그자체

当之无愧的第九艺术神作，剧情相当精彩，不过本体剧情与前两代几乎没有关联，没玩过前两代也可以放心入，另外海葬DLC和一代剧情形成闭环，在时间线上这一代相当于是一代的前传。打到本体结局的时候真的相当震撼，那种感觉不亚于看星际穿越的时候，只能不停地卧槽，无数的伏笔一下子涌入脑海，好像一瞬间明白了所有事情，但又有些似懂非懂，之后就去网上看了各种剧情解读，真的是回味无穷。

无限的另外一大亮点无疑是女主伊丽莎白了。还记得救出伊丽莎白后的第一场战斗，战斗的音乐才刚响起，屏幕上就出现了一行字：在战斗中你不需要担心伊丽莎白，她可以照顾好自己。当时的感觉就是意外又惊喜，以前玩别的游戏，在战斗的同时还要顾及npc的安危，完全就是带着一个拖油瓶；而这个柔弱的女孩却不一样，她不简单。到这里，这个游戏给我的感觉瞬间就不一样了。

在之后的战斗中我才明白，她岂止可以照顾好自己，甚至还来照顾我。多少次，当我子弹快打完了，她从不知道哪里捡来一支枪，叫我接着；当我被打得只剩血皮了，屏幕闪着红光只听得到自己的心跳，却又忽然听到她的声音：“Booker! You're hurt! First-aid!" 然后丢给我一个大血包起死回生；哪怕是我以为自己被打死了，睁开眼看到的也是她在给我打药。甚至在看到我站在售货机前纠结的时候，在看到我满大街垃圾桶翻物资的时候，她还会给我丢钱：“Booker, catch!" 我还有什么不知足的？伊丽莎白，你是我的神！

看着她从天真烂漫的少女一步步成长，自始至终与你并肩作战，没有一个人不会对这样一位女孩产生患难与共的情感吧，玩家如此，主角布克亦是如此。还记得那个在沙滩上翩翩起舞的伊丽莎白，多么希望让时间永远停留在那一刻，没有什么债务，也没有什么巴黎，只有那刚刚冲出囚笼的飞鸟，和她那随心而动却绝美的舞蹈。

奈何故事总有落幕的那一刻，本想着在dlc中与伊丽莎白再续前缘，没想到得到的却是更甚的意难平。不管怎样，都不影响我给好评，这个游戏绝对值这个价，冲就完了！

Kupiłem Bioshock The Collection za 50zł na przecenie. Od tamtego czasu jestem fanem serii.
Pierwsze 2 części bardzo mi się dłużyły ale i tak dobrze się przy nich bawiłem ale zdecydowanie moim faworytem jest Bioshock Infinite, którego przeszedłem ze wszystkimi DLC (12 godz.). Gra posiada bardzo ładną grafikę jak na tamte czasy. Posiada ciekawą fabułę i fajne mechaniki i dużo ładnych widoków. Jestem świeżo co po przejściu gry ale i tak przeszedłbym ją jeszcze raz.
La historia, juego entretenido, concepto artístico, música, en verdad vale lo que pagas.
剧情看不懂，还被背刺了

ในตัวอย่างโชว์อย่างนึงแต่ในเกมจริงไม่มี okคือไม่ใช่เกมนี้เกมเดียวที่ตัดเนื้อหาบ้างอย่างออกไป แต่ตัดออกไปมันทำให้เกมแย่ไหม ไม่เลย แต่มันก็ไม่ใช่ตัดไปน้อยๆสะด้วยดิ สมมุติว่าถ้ามันมีในตัวเกมจริงละมันจะสุดยอดมากแค่ไหน ลองไปหาในยูทูปเอาก็ได้

แต่ข้อเสียที่ผมบอกไปสุดท้ายมันก็กลบด้วยความท้าทายของเกม เนื้อเรื่องที่มีความซับซ้อน ผมก็อยากแนะนำเกมนี้เป็นเกมที่ควรค่าแก่การกลับมาเล่นเพราะผมกลับมาเล่นทีไร ผมยังรู้สึกenjoyกับเกมนี้ เกมที่ไม่ได้gotyก็ไม่ได้หมายความว่าเกมมันจะแย่(แต่กูเซ้งอะที่แน่ๆ)

Pure masterpiece. It withstand the test of time.

Bioshock Infinite is a worthy successor to the original Bioshock. It has many of the same mechanics but is a completely new experience with its on unique characters, story/plot, setting etc. The graphics even today in 2022 are beautiful, it spots a lot of high resolution textures and unique models in the world which make it feel unique and believable. The gunplay is satisfying and the freedom to move across rails and leap from great heights gives the combat a fluid and dynamic feel. What steals the show is the first ever competent NPC I think we've ever seen in a FPS, Elizabeth. They've managed to make sure she doesn't block your movement, she intuitively stays near you either ahead or behind but never blocks your path, she alerts you to items in your area and in combat will even seek out things you need and throw them to you, they truly set a new standard for NPC design in this game. The story is intruiging, it keeps you constantly interested with a cast of eccentric characters and balances the pacing of story and combat extremely well.

Even if you just want a dumb FPS shooter to blast people and don't care about any of the above, you'll still not be disappointed, this game is solid in every way and you should definitely buy it.

Not an FPS fan, since I get motion sickness with first-person cameras. As an FPS, the game-play itself isn't quite as interesting as Borderlands. However, the artistic aspects of Bioshock Infinite is top-tier even in 2022. The visuals, the music, the story fit together beautifully. The sci-fi elements aren't forced like in most other games. The mysteries keep you hooked. Highly recommended.

Booker, Are You afraid of God?

很久之前，我曾听闻许多人夸赞《生化奇兵：无限》，称它为“第九艺术”，那是传统八大艺术：绘画、雕刻、建筑、音乐、文学、舞蹈、戏剧、电影之外的新兴艺术形式。
初入游戏时，游戏内精美的雕塑、宏大的场景、直摄人心的配乐、惊为天人的建筑、震撼人心的故事令人折服。
随着游戏推进，我被这种美丽所感动，这款游戏太美了，它的一切是那么的美丽，那么的璀璨，时代在技术上不断前行，但《生化奇兵：无限》超越了时间，像大理石雕塑一般长存，像王冠上的珍宝一样耀眼。
太美了，它是优秀的小说，优秀的游戏，优秀的电影，优秀的绘画，优秀的建筑，一场优秀的戏剧。
游戏也可以是艺术，第九艺术，曾不被认可的艺术。而这，就是最好的证明。

If you're looking for Bioshock, I mean, it's in the name, but... it's not really Bioshock, and I just can't think of this game without comparing it to the rest of the series. Maybe that's unfair, but actually I don't care. It doesn't feel like Bioshock, it REALLY doesn't play like Bioshock, and it might not have been a big deal that it's so different if they did it right. But they didn't. If I'm being completely honest, this should have just been its own game, it would make a lot more sense that way.

That said, compared to Rapture Bioshocks, the core gameplay kinda sucks, and there were slight technical problems that made me wish I could manually save. It makes me feel like the game won't trust me to do it myself. Can't be trusted to use your own health kits, pick your own weapons whenever you want, let alone save your own game. Plus it caused a nuclear meltdown on my desktop at least once, nothing broke but it was such a pain to deal with.



Anyway. Yeah this game ain't fun to play. All concepts of self-sustained, strategic combat are completely thrown away. You don't have all weapons at once to choose from, and what you do find out in the world is diluted by faction copies, and you can't upgrade everything. A lot of stuff gets offloaded onto Elizabeth, basically your caddy for the game. She only gives you ammo you're in the middle of using, so nothing outside of fights, and nothing if you're completely out of ammo. Medkits and salts are completely out of your control, so you're constantly pleading with Elizabeth to help you. But don't worry, there's an overshield mechanic. Who cares that you're not responsible for your own health anymore, you have a definitely adequate safeguard that recharges itself, and a temperamental NPC replacement for health kits that sometimes just doesn't cooperate!!! This is sound game design that definitely fits in with the foundation of Bioshock game design they tried to hold on to, given that idk, I guess they expect you to scrounge for health or just buy it from vending machines between fights!

Not much to say about vigors, aka plasmids, because of a similar problem. You can't use them to fight long term because oops! You don't carry salts with you (not like they're really that combat oriented anyway). You just have to suffer from painfully reduced resource capacity. Sure, there's plenty to find in the world, but you are always going to be dependent on the game to do things for you unless you waste your time hunting it down. It's too bad, considering how good Bioshock 2 was with all that. Like sure, you'd always be full on everything you'd ever want, but at least you had it! (although, is it really a good comparison, carrying everything you find versus using it as you find it? or am i just selfish and want easy games?)

(also, regarding upgrades that cost many thousands of dollars over the course of the game, and ignoring longstanding bioshock game design, you end up with thousands of dollars stored at all times, which has pretty bad ramifications for a series that formerly made you dependent on buying things that now cost fractions of a fraction of your money, if you couldn't find it, which you might not if the game is carefully designed. but yknow that's real deep in the weeds about item economy and pacing and all kinds of design intricacies that this game is clearly too good for, being an action shooter unlike its predecessors. so yeah moving on)

Combat is GOD AWFUL but maybe that's an exaggeration but I don't care. First of all, sometimes there's a vague hint that you even CAN be stealthy, but that just doesn't happen here. But seriously, shootouts aren't very fun. Enemies have a tendency to stumble around and disappear behind cover if you so much as look at them. You only really get one good shot off before they duck out of sight. Turrets aren't a resource anymore, they're just an enemy type to kill. And don't even get me STARTED on the handymen. The worst single enemy I think I've ever fought ever. In any video game I've ever played. Which isn't really saying a lot, but they're awful Every time they move they shake your screen like they MEAN IT, you just can't aim at all when they're anywhere near you. Thankfully there's only two required fights. They're also nothing like Big Daddies, which is too bad. Barring that whole discussion, I miss caring about whether I could pass up fights or if it was worth it. No choice here.

Level design just okay for a pretty straightforward level-based shooter, everything feels too big and wide open. You never get a good chance to get really close when it matters unless the game makes it a point to put you there. There's comparatively little exploration available for one thing, so have fun looking at one or two side rooms before you reach the next objective. And also it feels wrong in comparison to Rapture but maybe I'm just homesick right?

AAAAND story. The story wasn't really there. I liked the supernatural stuff, but there was almost none of it, and basically zero horror elements. I liked the themes, "constants and variables" is a very oversimplified way to put it but there's something there. Or, there would be if it had something that built off it well. All the specifics don't really matter after a certain point, and I don't know whether I'm just dumb or I missed something or this game really is as confusing and nonsensical as that. Like it's to the point where Bioshock 1 makes more sense why things happened, and I personally think that game makes almost no sense. I won't go into detail but it's all just ridiculous and stupid to me. Themes and plot devices are cool, plot itself is not. Too bad about Songbird, though, for all the pain they went through to make him seem like a Big Daddy, or maybe a Big Sister if Ken Levine knew what that was, he really wasn't.

All the DLC have their own reviews, and Clash in the Clouds doesn't even count as real DLC (just a showcase of how bad combat really is. avoid), but in short, Burial at Sea wastes so much time trying to make the original seem "even better", which is a stretch I put in quotes because for one, the original can only get so much better when it wasn't good in the first place, and also trying to cram Infinite's characters into it just doesn't work at all. Like, if they wanted an "Elizabeth in Rapture" story then sure, go ahead! That's a great chance to revisit Rapture in yet another light, giving Elizabeth's character mileage outside of the main game. But they got so caught up trying to justify Bioshock's original story for some reason, they flubbed it hard.

Also. Elizabeth girl you Have Something. That awkward half run and always shuffling around when Booker's talking, leaning over to inspect everything, not knowing what to do with your hands, like girl you are Special in More Than One Way, I can tell. yeah anyway. I'm never going to touch this game again ok bye <3

very good!

[h1]Masterpiece[/h1]

O encerramento perfeito para essa saga incrível que foi Bioshock.

Bioshock Infinite é bem diferente dos jogos anteriores. Ele se passa em Columbia, que é uma cidade linda e cheia de vida. Um contraste enorme com Rapture.

Tem a melhor história entre os três jogos e a mais complicada de se entender também. É  daquelas que você não consegue dormir depois de jogar, pois você vai ficar matutando ela na sua cabeça o tempo todo.

A jogabilidade é excelente. É muito satisfatório usar as armas e os vigores e criar combinações pra derrotar os inimigos. É tudo muito fluido e as armas bem bastante impacto.

Uma pena que o Inifinite não adotou a seleção de armas igual tem nos dois primeiros jogos. Você é obrigado a usar apenas duas por vez e isso é um pouco chato, pois no jogo tem muitas armas diferentes e dá vontade de usar todas.

A DLC Burial At Sea é a cereja do bolo. A história dela é simplesmente incrível, fecha a narrativa da campanha principal e faz a ligação com o Bioshock 1.

Sente-se e prepare-se para a ascensão. Hallelujah.

Jogo comprado na promoção junto aos outros 2. Um bom jogo FPS com uma estética maravilhosa e uma história envolvente e um final que até gerou surpresa, não me deparei com nenhum bug grave, apenas texturas estranhas e objetos atravessando outros. Para um jogo na promoção é ótimo, foram boas 8h jogando.

La trama me ha violado el cerebro y Elizabeth el corazon.
Juegazo 10/10 Fresquisimo en 2022

Ho acquistato il bundle di BioShock (che includeva le remaster), con l'intento di recuperare l'intera trilogia.
Il primo non mi ha preso e nemmeno l'ho finito (ma mi ha comunque permesso di capire perché sia così adorato), il secondo l'ho proprio saltato, questo terzo capitolo è stata magia. 
Credo sia la prova di come anche un genere "tutto muscoli e niente cervello" come uno sparatutto possa essere Arte.
